data.title: Ujung Kulon National Park
data.text: Ujung Kulon National Park is a national park at the westernmost tip of Java in Banten province of Indonesia It once included the volcanic island group of Krakatoa in Lampung province although current maps suggest the Krakatoa island group as its own protected area the Pulau Anak Krakatau Marine Nature Reserve Ujung Kulon means Western End or Point West in Sundanese Geography The park encompasses an area of of which is marine Most of the park landmass lies on the Ujung Kulon peninsula reaching into the Indian Ocean The explosion of nearby Krakatau in 1883 produced a tsunami that claimantly eliminated the villages and crops of the coastal areas on the western peninsula and covered the entire area in a layer of ash averaging thick This caused a major evacuation of people from the peninsula thereby allowing it to become a repository for much of Java s flora and fauna and most of the remaining lowland forest on the island
